channel.title: git bash awk on Tim Van Wassenhove
channel.description: Recent content in git bash awk on Tim Van Wassenhove

item.title: Clone all your repositories on another machine
item.description: Recently I was configuring a new machine (God, i love Chocolatey) and I wanted to take all the repositories I have under c:/src and clone them on my new machine. Here is how i did that: # write all remote fetch locations into repositories.txt find /c/src -type d -mindepth 1 -maxdepth 1 -exec git -work-tree={} -git-dir={}/.git remote -v \; | grep fetch | awk '{print $2}' > repositories.txt # clone each repository cat repositories.
